meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unpleasant in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The ugliness of the old building made it hard to look at.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't ignore the ugliness of the graffiti on the wall.
meanings.sent3: Despite its ugliness, the quirky sculpture brought smiles to people's faces.
meanings.sent4: The ugliness of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: The ugliness of the painting was so striking that it stayed in her mind for days.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being morally offensive or objectionable.
meanings.sent1: The ugliness of the crime shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent2: They couldn't tolerate the ugliness of the lies being spread.
meanings.sent3: The ugliness of the situation was so absurd that it almost seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: The ugliness of his betrayal cut deeper than any physical wound.
meanings.sent5: The ugliness of the injustice burned in their hearts, fueling their determination for change.
